title: Google Is a Monopolist in Online Advertising Tech, Judge Says
summary: The ruling was the second time in a year that a federal court had found that Google had acted illegally to maintain its dominance.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Antitrust Efforts Against Google, Meta and Other Tech Giants
summary: The Trump administration is continuing an aggressive effort to rein in the power of the biggest tech companies. Here’s what to know.

title: IMF Warns Trump Tariffs Will Weaken Economy and Increase Inflation
summary: Kristalina Georgieva, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, warned in a speech that protectionism erodes productivity.

title: European Central Bank Cuts Rates Amid Tariff Uncertainty
summary: Policymakers lowered rates a quarter point and said that the region’s growth outlook had “deteriorated” because of rising trade tensions.

title: New Pushback to Trump’s Deportations, and Climate Research Under Threat
summary: Plus, a capybara controversy in Argentina.

title: I.R.S. Is Said to Be Considering Whether to Revoke Harvard’s Tax-Exempt Status
summary: The move would be a major escalation of the Trump administration’s attempts to choke off federal money and support for the leading research university.

title: Why Does Harvard Have Tax-Exempt Status and Can the IRS Revoke It? What to Know.
summary: The university, like many colleges and charities, is exempt from federal income and property taxes, saving it billions of dollars. President Trump has questioned whether it should enjoy that status.

title: Trump’s Threats Force Powerful Institutions to Choose: Cut a Deal or Resist
summary: In a hint of a shift in strategy, some of the country’s most powerful institutions have started choosing to resist.

title: Texas Is Poised to Create a $1 Billion Private School Voucher Program
summary: The Texas House approved the plan, part of a push by President Trump’s allies to offer up to about $10,000 for private school, home-school or virtual learning.

title: The Fight Between Trump and Public Schools Over DEI Escalates
summary: Can President Trump withhold federal money for low-income students? A brewing fight over diversity, equity and inclusion programs may force the courts to decide.

title: Trump Waved Off Planned Israeli Strike on Iranian Nuclear Sites
summary: Israel developed plans for attacking Iranian nuclear facilities that would have required U.S. assistance. But some administration officials had doubts.

title: Iran Says Despite Shifting U.S. Messages, It Plans to Keep Participating in Nuclear Talks
summary: But Iran’s foreign minister said Tehran planned to participate “calmly and coolly” in the negotiations. Both sides will meet in Rome on Saturday for a second round, Iran’s Foreign Ministry said.

title: White House Eyes Overhaul of Federal Housing Aid to the Poor
summary: The Trump administration has considered sharply curtailing vouchers as part of its budget for the 2026 fiscal year.

title: Republican Lawmakers Face Fresh Backlash to Trump at Home
summary: Despite some attempts to create controlled environments aimed at thwarting disruptions by protesters, congressional Republicans who are holding town halls are catching continued heat from their constituents.

title: Boasberg Finds Probable Cause to Hold Trump Officials in Contempt Over Deportation Flights
summary: The move was a remarkable attempt by a jurist to hold the White House accountable for its apparent willingness to flout court orders.

title: He Wanted Peace in the Middle East. ICE Wants to Deport Him.
summary: Mohsen Mahdawi was arrested at a citizenship interview in Vermont. He had spent a decade trying to understand the conflict that shaped his life, his supporters say.

title: Daily Pill May Work as Well as Ozempic for Weight Loss and Blood Sugar
summary: Clinical results of a GLP-1 in pill form showed safety and efficacy data similar to blockbuster injectable drugs.

title: Astronomers Detect a Signature of Life on a Distant Planet
summary: Further studies are needed to determine whether K2-18b, which orbits a star 120 light-years away, is inhabited, or even habitable.

title: What Mark Zuckerberg’s Washington, D.C., Mansion Says About His Ideological Shifts
summary: Mark Zuckerberg’s political ideology and tastes have evolved. His real estate portfolio reflects the shift.

title: Hundreds of Capybaras ‘Conquered’ This Town. Now What?
summary: The world’s largest rodent is multiplying in — and dividing — one of Argentina’s most exclusive gated communities.

title: The Emergency Is Here
summary: Trump is disappearing people to a Salvadoran prison for terrorists. And he says he wants to send “homegrown” Americans there next.

title: Trump Targets K-12
summary: We explain why the president is taking on public schools, and how officials are responding.

title: Stephen Colbert Defends PBS and NPR Against Trump’s Defunding Plan
summary: Colbert said both public media entities are “already operating on a shoestring budget — Daniel Tiger can’t even afford to wear pants.”

title: The Ukrainian Schoolmaster Teaching History to His Invaders
summary: Vitalii Dribnytsia engages with Russians online to correct Kremlin propaganda about Ukraine. Over time, he has come to realize his more important audience is Ukrainians themselves.

title: Israel Strikes Area With Tent Camps for Displaced Gazans
summary: The attack on the Mawasi area of southern Gaza killed at least a dozen people, according to the emergency rescue service in the territory. Israel did not confirm the location of the attack.

title: U.K. Court Ruling on Trans Women Is Part of Wider Debate on Sex and Gender
summary: President Trump and right-wing politicians in Europe have railed against trans rights. Britain’s top court has now added its voice to the discussion.

title: What Is Happening With Fyre Festival 2?
summary: The organizers of Fyre Festival 2, a sequel to the ill-fated music event in 2017, said the festival would not longer take place in Playa del Carmen.
